channel.title: 8-Year-Old Accidentally Exercises Second Amendment Rights
channel.description:
NORFOLK, VA—Gun owners nationwide are applauding the patriotic, though accidental, exercise of Second Amendment rights by 8-year-old Timothy Cummings Tuesday. "Timothy is a symbol of American heroism," said NRA executive vice president Wayne LaPierre from Cummings' bedside at Norfolk General Hospital, where the boy is in serious but stable condition from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. "While praying for his recovery, we should all thank God that his inalienable right to keep and bear arms has not been infringed." The incident occurred shortly after Cummings returned from school and found that his parents were absent from the house. Displaying what Second Amendment-rights groups are calling "good old-fashioned American ingenuity," Cummings placed a pair of phone books on a stool to retrieve his father's loaded .38-caliber revolver from its hiding place on a closet shelf. After a preliminary backyard investigation of his constitutional rights claimed the life of Pepper, the family's cocker spaniel, Cummings fell on the weapon, causing it to discharge into his left thigh.
[url=http://www.theonion.com/articles/8yearold-accidentally-exercises-second-amendment-r,725/#content]Full article[/url] Let's just see where this goes...

item.title: 8-Year-Old Accidentally Exercises Second Amendment Rights
item.dc:creator: @Brett2 Brett`
item.description:
@Brett2 wrote:

Man, I thought I lived in a hick state. But this stuff could only happen in such a fine state as Virgina!

MITB I agree, I was taught at the age of 4 not to mess with guns and how to handle them safely! There IS such a thing as trigger locks and not keeping the pistol loaded would have helped… If only this story were true lol.

Read full topic

item.title: 8-Year-Old Accidentally Exercises Second Amendment Rights
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Haha, I thought we didn’t post stuff from theonion.com here.

Anyway, if anything like this really did happen it would be 100% the parents fault for not:

  1. Teaching children from an early age about guns, the danger of them, how to safely handle them, and, perhaps most importantly, to only touch them with adult supervision.
  2. Leaving the gun accessible to the child.

Read full topic

item.title: 8-Year-Old Accidentally Exercises Second Amendment Rights
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Those NRA types are complete idiots. All things aside, assuming second amendment rights are okay, we still don’t give them to children.
The first amendment protects freedom of speech but we don’t allow children of formative age to watch 18-rated films because of the possibility of them being corrupted by it. In the same way we cant allow children to have guns in this way.

Rights like these are for adults only.

edit: theonion.com lolol, I can’t believe I fell for it. Well I suppose that shows what I think of 2nd Amendment people, they’re capable of anything.
This is an example of Poe’s law

Read full topic

item.title: 8-Year-Old Accidentally Exercises Second Amendment Rights

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

So he shot his dog and then himself? Taking bets on him having a record for a school shooting in another 8 years!!

Because the constitution said he could.
